title: Why is Matchmaking still so terribly unbalanced while leveling, and there's nobody looking at it...
body:
I mean c'mon my last game had 3*30's on the other team,  Its unbalanced and its no fun..

There's no riot response to this, except [this](http://boards.eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-en/cjxPGVkm-what-is-wrong-with-ur-matchmakings?comment=0001#) guy who agree's its no fun..

What about the game's espoused Design Values (Quoted from Riot)

The basic priorities of the system are (in respective order):

1. Protecting new players from experienced players.
2. Maintaining fairness and creating competitive matches.
3. Finding a match at all Â– the longer the wait, the lower the priority given to #1 and #2 becomes.

This isnt a case of number 3. These matches take no time at all to start..

One team has 3 people with a full set of runes and mastery's, that's a 1500g advantage..

1 & 2 Just arn't happening! Why cant you guys sort this, its the core of your game...

replies.body:
I actually thought that matching new players with other new players is impossible. Just think about it; how many times are you going to be a new player in the course of you playing the game? Once. Even if you go and make a new account, you'll still have the experience and knowledge of your previous endeavours. The best that Riot can do in this situation is to match players of equal skill, so that the new players are matched with less skilled experienced players.

In addition to that, you're implying that experience automatically makes a player better. Although experience is the best way to learn, some people have different ways of learning to others. For instance, many people have no idea how to efficiently use their wards unless someone sits down and talks to them about it, or they read a guide.

Nevertheless, this isn't the appropriate board for such discussion. Head over to the [Miscellaneous](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous) board.

Ok, well lets ignore my implication that level 30's with hundreds of games under their belt will be more experienced than say a lvl 20, just getting close to 80 pvp games, and the big correlation you can see consistently in sub 30 game's between player level and skill.



My issue which somehow wasn't clear is a lvl 30 starts with about 10 more AD, Armor and MR from runes than someone with none.
Masteries increase these by a percentile which lets ignore, but will definitely mean they snowball harder.

Basically they get a free longsword and cloth armor at the start of the game.

We had to lane against 3 people on the other team with a 500-660g head start.


**My question for Player support** is how is this "maintaining fairness", how are you "protecting new players".
Two things your matchmaking system is apparently designed around.

>level 30's with hundreds of games under their belt will be more experienced than say a lvl 20

That is extreme.

>My issue which somehow wasn't clear is a lvl 30 starts with about 10 more AD, Armor and MR from runes than someone with none.

And this is why I hate things like pre-game armor management that gives you a buff in game. Masteries and runes should have never been implemented.

I whole-heartedly agree with you on that. I just thought you were asking for the impossible; to have new players only verse other new players. It's still desirable, but only a dream.
